message: sure, if you have access to the device's bluetooth discovery list, then you could leave a bluetooth device in said area and an app running on your users' mobile could discover said device and act accordingly.
@osama19 this app depends on gps right ?
If you're into Apple iOS development, you might want to check out the new geo-fencing stuff in iOS 5. Highly interesting.
@blacktar we need to support android and old iPhone versions too

Another cute hack in some narrow cases might be to detect ("somehow") that one of their friends posts that they are together through a social network - so in some cases this could work even if the location-aware technology is in someone else's pocket.

Geofencing is available on the carrier side - as long as a user has a cell signal, you can get an alert based on towers and can then, say, sms to a feature phone or send something more eloborate to a smart phone. So totally possible w/o smart phone.
